title: Did all members of the Beatles write a number one single? - Quora

response.answer_text: WOW, so much misinformation here, how about some facts (this is for their career not just during their time with the Beatles): After The Beatles broke up in 1970, each band member began successful solo careers. George Harrison would be the first to score a No. 1 hit (“My Sweet Lord”) in 1970. Next up would be Paul McCartney with “Uncle Albert/Admiral Halsey” in 1971. However, Ringo beat the great John Lennon to the punch. In 1973, Ringo hit No. 1 on the Billboard Hot 100 with “Photograph,” a tune he wrote with Harrison and recorded with his solo band. Just two months later (January of ’74), Ringo made it back to the top of the charts with his rendition of “You’re 16.” Lennon didn’t make it there until November of that year, when “Whatever Gets You Through the Night” hit No. 1. Ringo nearly made it to No. 1 with The Beatles with “Yellow Submarine” reached #2 but, as the saying goes, sometimes you need to do it yourself to make sure it’s done right. Now if you limit it to JUST their time as Beatles then I am sure all their #1 hits were by Lennon/McCartney except George Harrison managed to just barely get one in with “Something” which made #1 off their last album recorded “Abbey Road” (yes I know “Let It Be” came after that but was actually recorded BEFORE “Abby Road” but was released late to coincide with the release of the film by the same name)
All the Beatles had #1 singles. Of course, Lennon & McCartney had the most #1 hits, George had his hit with “My Sweet Lord” & “Something” & Ringo had his hit with “It Don’t Come Easy” & “Photograph”.

Ringo never wrote a number one. As to whether the others did depends on which country you’re talking about. I know Something only reached number 4 in their home country, leaving only Paul and John to have written number 1 singles in the UK.

Arguably no as a band - this is since Ringo as far as I know only wrote Octopus’ Garden but I may stand to be corrected on that. On reflection he did have a great hit in his solo career with Photograph, It don't come easy and Back Off Boogaloo. The other 3 all had hits both with the band and solo too.
Maybe Ringos singles was number one in Sweden or Germany, I dont know. I know though, that he never had a #1 hit in England or the States. I believe It Dont Come Easy went to #4 and Photograph #2.
No. The first band to do that was queen.
